title.narrative: Co-designing Community-based ICTs Interventions to Enhance Maternal and Child Health in South Africa

description.narrative: Digital interventions to support maternal and child health (MCH) are widespread. Yet, the impact of these interventions in low-income communities is limited. We believe this is in part due to the top-down nature of digital health development, and propose to take a participatory and community-centred approach to this domain. We will form a multidisciplinary, cross-cultural, and cross-geographical consortium of researchers, technology designers, healthcare professionals and community stakeholders, policy makers, and grassroots citizens' organizations to explore the potential of information and communication technologies (ICTs) to enhance maternal and child health and wellbeing during the antenatal and postnatal period in South Africa.

a) develop and consolidate a cross-disciplinary network to explore, co-design, share, inspire and develop new innovative ways to address MCHh challenges through digital health, b) identify and engage with key stakeholders (professional, policy, communities and industry) through a co-design inquiry approach (or community engagement activities) to get a deeper understanding of the complex social, structructural and economic factors that can strengthen or weaken MCH digital interventions, c) explore, create and test a set of creative and alternative scenarios of emerging digital health tools and services to foster discussions between the network and the identified community stakeholders about emerging research priorities, refinement of research questions, implications/role of ICTs for addressing the social determinants of MCH in South Africa to shape a 2nd phase proposal.
